com.mapgroup.classificator.tree

Class SplitNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapgroup.classificator.tree.Node
      • com.mapgroup.classificator.tree.SplitNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SplitNode>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContinuousNode, DiscreteNode

    public abstract class SplitNode
extends Node
implements java.lang.Comparable<SplitNode>
    Models the split node abstract entity extended its superclass Node. Within it is present the SplitInfo class which contains all the information which concerns a split node.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  SplitNode.SplitInfo
      This class contains all the information about the split node.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Attribute attribute
      Independent attribute on which the split is generated
      protected float infoGain
      attribute's information gain
      protected java.util.List<SplitNode.SplitInfo> mapSplit
      List of all the possible split values for this independent attribute

      • Fields inherited from class com.mapgroup.classificator.tree.Node

        classValueAbsoluteFrequency, entropy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SplitNode(Data trainingSet, int beginExampleIndex, int endExampleIndex, Attribute attribute)
      Constructs a split node with the specified information Invokes the superclass' constructor, orders the input attribute values for the examples contained in the training subset identified by beginExampleIndex and endExampleIndex and uses this order in order to determine the possible split value and populate mapSplit, computes the attribute's entropy and determines its information gain.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(SplitNode s)
      Defines an order relationship on the split nodes based upon the information gain that they had.
      java.lang.String formulateQuery()
      Generates all the information of each test in a single string that will be displayed during the prediction session.
      Attribute getAttribute()
      Returns the attribute used in the split operation.
      (package private) float getInformationGain()
      Returns the information associated to this split node.
      int getNumberOfChildren()
      Returns the number of split generated by this split node.
      (package private) SplitNode.SplitInfo getSplitInfo(int child)
      Returns the SplitInfo object associated to a specific child of this split node, identified by the specified integer value child.
      protected abstract void setSplitInfo(Data trainingSet, int beginExampleIndex, int endExampleIndex, Attribute attribute)
      Abstract method which is used in order to generate the information needed for each candidate split node.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representation of this split node which contains all the information about each test, such as the training subset analyzed, the information gain value and the entropy value.

      • Methods inherited from class com.mapgroup.classificator.tree.Node

        getBeginExampleIndex, getEndExampleIndex, getEntropy

      • attribute

        private final Attribute attribute
        Independent attribute on which the split is generated

        protected java.util.List<SplitNode.SplitInfo> mapSplit

    • Constructor Detail

      • SplitNode

        SplitNode(Data trainingSet,
         int beginExampleIndex,
         int endExampleIndex,
         Attribute attribute)
        Constructs a split node with the specified information

        Invokes the superclass' constructor, orders the input attribute values for the examples contained in the training subset identified by beginExampleIndex and endExampleIndex and uses this order in order to determine the possible split value and populate mapSplit, computes the attribute's entropy and determines its information gain.

        Parameters:
        trainingSet - the whole training set
        beginExampleIndex - starter index of the training subset
        endExampleIndex - last index of the training subset
        attribute - independent attribute on which the split is defined

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(SplitNode s)
        Defines an order relationship on the split nodes based upon the information gain that they had.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<SplitNode>
        Parameters:
        s - the node that will be compared with this split node
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this split node has an information gain less than, equal to, or greater than the specified split node.

      • formulateQuery

        public java.lang.String formulateQuery()
        Generates all the information of each test in a single string that will be displayed during the prediction session.
        Returns:
        formatted information about each single test

      • getAttribute

        public Attribute getAttribute()
        Returns the attribute used in the split operation.
        Returns:
        attribute object

      • getInformationGain

        float getInformationGain()
        Returns the information associated to this split node.
        Returns:
        this split node's information gain

      • getNumberOfChildren

        public int getNumberOfChildren()
        Returns the number of split generated by this split node.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfChildren in class Node
        Returns:
        returns mapSplit's size

      • getSplitInfo

        SplitNode.SplitInfo getSplitInfo(int child)
        Returns the SplitInfo object associated to a specific child of this split node, identified by the specified integer value child.
        Parameters:
        child - identifier for the split
        Returns:
        information about the specified child

      • setSplitInfo

        protected abstract void setSplitInfo(Data trainingSet,
                int beginExampleIndex,
                int endExampleIndex,
                Attribute attribute)
        Abstract method which is used in order to generate the information needed for each candidate split node.
        Parameters:
        trainingSet - the whole training set
        beginExampleIndex - starter index of the training subset
        endExampleIndex - last index of the training subset
        attribute - independent attribute on which the split is defined

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a formatted string representation of this split node which contains all the information about each test, such as the training subset analyzed, the information gain value and the entropy value.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Node
        Returns:
        string representation for this split node
